required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Kinesio® Tex Taping for Post Total Knee Replacement Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy of Kinesio® Tex Taping on Edema and Early Functional Outcome of Post Total Knee Replacement Patients: a Randomized-controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock: This study is designed to better understand the effect of Kinesiotaping applied using the Neurotaping tecnique on patients who underwent total knee artrhoplasty surgery. Patients will be randomized in two groups: in the first group patients will follow a protocol of usual rehabilitation, while the second group will do the same but add the Kinesiotaping application. Main outcome will be the effect on edema, secondary outcome the effect on functionality after 13 days post surgery.

study_design_info.masking_description: Randomization list has been already generated but will not be available to the recruiters to avoid allocation bias. Statistician that will handle the data anlysis will not know which group is the interventional and which group is the control. We were not able to mask the using of tape to the patients or the investigators because it is an evident treatment.

primary_outcome.time_frame: pre-operative, 3rd post-operative day, 7th post operative day,13th post-operative day
primary_outcome.description: Difference between pre-operative knee circumference and 13th post-operative day knee circumference expressed in cm

secondary_outcome.description: Pain expressed on a 10 cm Visual Analogue Scale

secondary_outcome.time_frame: pre-operative, 3rd post-operative day, 7th post operative day,13th post-operative day

arm_group.description: Kinesio Tex taping treatment for 10 days + usual care

intervention.description: Kinesio Tex tape on the operated limb

reference.citation: Williams S, Whatman C, Hume PA, Sheerin K. Kinesio taping in treatment and prevention of sports injuries: a meta-analysis of the evidence for its effectiveness. Sports Med. 2012 Feb 1;42(2):153-64. doi: 10.2165/11594960-000000000-00000. Review.

Morris D, Jones D, Ryan H, Ryan CG. The clinical effects of Kinesio® Tex taping: A systematic review. Physiother Theory Pract. 2013 May;29(4):259-70. doi: 10.3109/09593985.2012.731675. Epub 2012 Oct 22. Review.

Bade MJ, Stevens-Lapsley JE. Restoration of physical function in patients following total knee arthroplasty: an update on rehabilitation practices. Curr Opin Rheumatol. 2012 Mar;24(2):208-14. doi: 10.1097/BOR.0b013e32834ff26d. Review.

Woźniak-Czekierda W, Woźniak K, Hadamus A, Białoszewski D. Use of Kinesiology Taping in Rehabilitation after Knee Arthroplasty: a Randomised Clinical Study. Ortop Traumatol Rehabil. 2017 Oct 31;19(5):461-468.

Donec V, Kriščiūnas A. The effectiveness of Kinesio Taping® after total knee replacement in early postoperative rehabilitation period. A randomized controlled trial. Eur J Phys Rehabil Med. 2014 Aug;50(4):363-71. Epub 2014 May 13.
